p: Previous studies over the past 30 years have strongly suggested that there are three possible ways by which G. frondosa exerts its anticancer effectâ€”they are protection of healthy cells, prevention of tumor metastasis and inhibition of tumor growth. In other words, G. frondosa can fight against tumors both directly and indirectly via enhancement of the immune system. This section will mainly focus on the direct antitumor function of G. frondosa, whereas the immunomodulatory effect will be discussed in the next section.
